subject: Real Estate
title: Adverse Possession: Stealing Land Legally
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Adverse Possession: Stealing Land Legally.

hook.text: Use someone's land openly for long enough, and the law may give it to you. Seriously.

buildup.text: Adverse possession requires continuous, open, and hostile use â€” meaning without the owner's permission.

discovery.text: The doctrine dates to medieval England, where unused land was considered wasted and given to productive users.

twist.text: In 2012, a man legally claimed a $330,000 Florida home by filing an adverse possession claim and moving in.

climax.text: Adverse possession forces owners to monitor their property. Neglect it long enough, and you lose it.

punchline.text: Use it openly long enough, and the law says it's yours.

quiz.question: What does adverse possession require?
options: Continuous, open use without owner's permission
